summary: Build an HTML-based Rweb Infotech static website with About Us, laptop catalog with specifications, location/contact details, and a dynamic visual presentation; support development in Visual Studio Code.
architectural_notes: Site will be built using plain HTML (static site).
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Rweb Infotech brand logo with tech laptop motif, warm orange and dark navy colors (rweb-logo.dim_200x60.png)
- Wide hero banner showing a sleek modern laptop on a dark background with warm orange accent lighting (hero-banner.dim_1200x400.png)
- Apple brand placeholder logo tile, minimalist white apple silhouette on warm gray background (brand-apple.dim_300x200.png)
- Dell brand placeholder logo tile, bold Dell wordmark style on warm gray background (brand-dell.dim_300x200.png)
- HP brand placeholder logo tile, HP circle logo style on warm gray background (brand-hp.dim_300x200.png)
- Asus brand placeholder logo tile, Asus wordmark style on warm gray background (brand-asus.dim_300x200.png)
- Generic laptop product placeholder image showing a side-view laptop silhouette on a light neutral background (laptop-placeholder.dim_600x400.png)
- Cute anime-style girl AI assistant avatar with warm expression, tech-themed accessories (chat-avatar.dim_128x128.png)

existing_features.title: Create a responsive Rweb Infotech marketing/catalog website frontend that presents a laptop catalog organized by brand and model, with clear navigation and page structure.
Implement a Brands view that lists available laptop brands and allows users to filter the catalog by selecting a brand.
Implement a Laptops (catalog) view that lists laptop models with key summary specs and supports basic searching and filtering.
Implement a Laptop Detail view that shows multiple images per laptop (image gallery) plus full specifications, and supports viewing multiple versions/variants of the same laptop model.
Connect the frontend to the backend APIs using React Query for loading states, caching, and error handling for brands, catalog, and laptop detail pages.
Apply a cohesive visual theme for the Rweb Infotech website (colors, typography, spacing, component styling) and enforce it consistently across all pages without using a blue/purple default palette.
Add generated static brand/laptop placeholder imagery as local frontend assets and use them in the UI when real product images are not available.

Update the site header to match the requested structure: show the Rweb Infotech logo, a search bar, and navigation links for Home, Products, About Us, and Contact; ensure the header remains responsive with a working mobile menu.
Add new routes/pages for Products, About Us, and Contact, and update existing page labels/content so user-facing navigation matches the requested IA (Home, Products, About Us, Contact) in English.

Implement a unified Products grid page that displays laptops, computers/desktops, and CPUs together, with clear product cards (including hover effects) and search support (driven by the header search bar).
Create a unified Product Detail page for all product categories that displays a gallery of 4–5 images and detailed specifications for the selected product.
Add a 'Buy Now' button on the Product Detail page that opens PhonePe via a UPI payment link; the link must be configurable (since no UPI id/link was provided) and should open in a new tab/window.
Update the site footer to include: About Us text, a Google Maps location link, CEO name, and contact phone number, while keeping the footer responsive and readable on mobile.

Rebuild the expired Rweb Infotech draft and ensure the application deploys successfully end-to-end (frontend + backend) without runtime errors, with all existing pages loading correctly in production.
Ensure the required generated static images exist under frontend/public/assets/generated and are correctly referenced by the UI (logo and hero/banner at minimum).
Create a new frontend Chat page that lets any visitor type questions and receive responses from the backend “cute girl” personal AI.
Update site navigation so users can discover and open the new Chat page from the existing layout.
Add a lightweight chat persona presentation on the Chat page including a static avatar image and brief assistant intro copy.
Ensure the new Chat feature works end-to-end in production builds with no runtime errors.
Rebuild and redeploy the entire Rweb Infotech application (frontend + backend) so it runs successfully in production without runtime errors

Ensure all required generated static images exist under frontend/public/assets/generated and are correctly referenced throughout the UI, including the Rweb Infotech logo, hero banner, brand placeholders, and laptop product images
Verify the About Us page exists with descriptive content about Rweb Infotech, accessible via navigation
Verify the Products page displays all laptops with key specifications (processor, RAM, storage) in a searchable and filterable grid
Verify the Contact page displays the company location (with Google Maps link), CEO name, and contact phone number in a mobile-responsive format
Verify the site maintains a cohesive, dynamic visual theme with consistent colors, typography, spacing, and interactive effects (hover states, transitions) across all pages

Rebuild and redeploy the entire Rweb Infotech application (frontend + backend) so it runs successfully in production without runtime errors, with all existing pages (Home, Products, Brands, Laptop Detail, About Us, Contact, Chat) loading correctly.

Ensure the visual theme across all pages is dynamic and engaging with a warm orange/amber color palette (non-blue/purple), consistent typography, spacing, hover effects on product cards, and smooth transitions on interactive elements.

Ensure all required generated static images exist under frontend/public/assets/generated and are correctly referenced throughout the UI, including the Rweb Infotech logo, hero/banner image, brand placeholder images, and laptop product images.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create an HTML Rweb Infotech website showcasing all laptop brands with specs, all versions/models, and multiple images per laptop.

Add a backend Motoko data model and query API for laptop brands, laptop models, and laptop versions/variants, including image metadata (list of image URLs/paths per model/version). Seed the canister with an initial dataset that demonstrates multiple brands and multiple versions per model.
Add product categories beyond laptops (computers/desktops and CPUs) and display them in a unified Products grid for brands like HP, Dell, Asus, and MacBook/Apple.
Implement product detail pages with a 4–5 image gallery per product and detailed specifications.
Add a 'Buy Now' button that opens PhonePe via a UPI payment link.
Create a header with logo, search bar, and navigation (Home, Products, About Us, Contact), plus a footer including About Us, Google Maps location link, CEO name, and contact number.
Ensure responsive, mobile-friendly UI with hover effects on product cards.

Expand the backend data model and query API beyond laptops to support a unified product catalog containing at least: laptops, computers/desktops, and CPUs, seeded with brands including HP, Dell, Asus, and Apple/MacBook; include enough image metadata so each product can display a 4–5 image gallery on the detail view.
Add a backend chat response API that returns a friendly, “cute girl” assistant style reply to any user question without using any external AI/LLM services.
Verify the Laptop Detail page displays full specifications for each laptop model, including support for viewing multiple variants/versions
Ensure the backend Motoko canister contains seeded data for multiple laptop brands (HP, Dell, Asus, Apple) with multiple models and variants per brand, each with 4-5 image paths
